title: BPL (complexity)
summary: In computational complexity theory, BPL (Bounded-error Probabilistic Logarithmic-space),[1] sometimes called BPLP (Bounded-error Probabilistic Logarithmic-space Polynomial-time),[2] is the complexity class of problems solvable in logarithmic space and polynomial time with probabilistic Turing machines with two-sided error. It is named in analogy with BPP, which is similar but has no logarithmic space restriction.
